intro: Coffea betamponensis, commonly known as the Betampona coffee, is a rare species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and red or purple flowers. The plant produces small, dark red berries containing two seeds, which are used to make coffee. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a unique and endangered species within the Coffea genus.
